Fields.DialogueText: Never thought I'd be this happy to catch sight of the Falklands.
But here we are. We made it.
Don't say we've made it til we've made it. We've still got a long way to go.
And with some wild things behind us.
Too wild. That Morgana installation... Even after all these months, we've never seen anything like it.
It's big news... In more ways than one.
Well, we never would have found any of it out without you. You and that compass.
Is it still whispering to you at night?
Kanchou! You know that was a joke, right?
Hey, you've "joked" about it enought times...
Well, they were jokes. ... Huh.
Mm?
Is it just me, or is the mist getting thicker?

Fields.MenuText: Hostiles inbound. We'll take care of it.
I *hope* it's just you.
No, I see it. That's worrying.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess it can't be helped...
I guess it can't be helped...
I just told you that it can.
... Maybe. I hope not.
I guess it can't be helped...
I'm not saying I don't trust you! Just--
*ALARM*
Kuso. That's a lot of Morganas...
We've got a lot of Belles on our side. We should be fine.
Let's hope so.
@BATTLE
*STATIC*
Oh, nein! Nicht schon wieder!
*CRACKLE* -- hope is always fa -- *CRACKLE*
....Kapitan... you might...
*SCREEEEEEEEEEEE*
Jetzt reicht es mir! Ich kann nicht länger....
*BZZZT*
What's going on? Cassel, status report.
Nnnnng.... my ergot. Where's--

Fields.MenuText: Report first, pills later.
I'll send someone to get them. What's going on?
Are you hurt? What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: Radio caught fire. Nng. My head.
Morgana signal. Strong. Too strong for... mgnph.
Not like you... Kapitan....
Stay with me, Cassel. It caught fire?
A radio signal did all this?
Something's gone FUBAR here. I need to know what.
C'n.... barely hear you, Kapitan....
'M.... M' ears won't stop ringing....
Dammit. Someone, get this man to the sickbay!
We're short our radio and our best radio operator. What else could go wrong?
Don't you dare say that, Capitaine. We've got a problem.
Hm?
Our Belle's lost her wits.

Fields.MenuText: How do you figure?
Did she ever have them to begin with?
I'm surprised it took her this long.

Fields.DialogueText: Il n’y a pas de quoi rire.
She's gone catatonic. Staring into space.
She keeps saying "this is not the end." But I can't get through to her.
You think it has something to do with the mist?
Maybe. It's gotten so thick we can't see a thing.
It wouldn't be a surprise if it was getting to her, one way or another.
You think every Belle--
I'd radio the other ships in the fleet, but... well...
Merde. We're sitting out in the middle of the ocean in the worst Morgana mist since this mess started, and we don't have any way to communicate.
We could always break out the semaphore.
In this mist?
*ALARM*
Well, that's one way to communicate.
....mnhngnnnn....
Get him to the infirmary, and get a visual on their flagship! Now!
Bad news, Kanchou. That's Disease.
As if this day couldn't get any better...
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
S...status re- *COUGH*
*Sit*.
You- you just shoved that chair- into my solar plexus-
It got you off your feet.
Nnn. Status report.
Ce semble peu prometteur.
That good, huh.
I'd say our doctors are out of commission, but somehow, they're both still trying to work.
Sounds like them.
Lugin's unconscious. And the others... you'd better see for yourself.
... Give me a moment.
Standing up is hard?
Feels like my lungs are full of smoke.
You can lean on me if you need to. But I think you need to see this.
Moments in the future, but not many...
Let me get this straight. You said Kirishima *died*?
She went into severe anaphylactic shock, yes. But--
But she's breathing.
Damnedest thing-- *WHEEZE*
I told you to sit down.
And I told *you* you were on bed rest- *WHEEZE* - but here we are.
She's alive. And stable. Ish.
Wouldn't be if our Belle hadn't shown up. She reached into Kirishima's chest.
Kept her heart pumping. We managed to get the epinephrine into her just in time.

Fields.MenuText: I'm just glad she's all right.
Belle magic. I'll never understand it.
... Suddenly I'm glad they're on our side.

Fields.DialogueText: Aren't we all, Kapitan.
... I don't think anyone does. But it's good to know...
... Moi aussi. ...I thought I'd never...
What?
-- C'est rien.
It's good to know we have it as an option.
What about the others?
McPhee's got a cough, but he's alive.
Glad to hear it.
Lugin and Miller are both unconscious. And Cassel...
He's awake, but he's been delirious for hours.
... don't want your stupid diamonds....
Papa... Why are you even here? I saw you... choking....
... He's been talking to his dad for hours. English and German. Almost enough to prick the conscience.
Sure it is. Speaking of conscience...
Mm?
How long do you think it'll be before everyone's back in commission?
"Everyone?" Could be months. We'll try to get a skeleton crew moving, but.
You know how your girl can run a ship all on her own? Magic again?
It might be time to test that.
*COUGH, COUGH*
Get back to bed, you menace.
Not while I'm still breathing.
If you don't, you won't be.
*COUGH*
Look *COUGH* alive, people! We're not done with them yet!
Heh.... I'm glad Fanny shipped you out to us.
Oh, no, not you too. We can't deal with another delirious fool aboard.
"Another?"
August's dragged himself to the radio room at least five times. Shouting into the broken mic at the top of his lungs.
Doing his best Morgana impression, apparently.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not delirious. I genuinely am glad you're here.
I'm just happy you and McPhee are here to pick up my slack.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, brother.
Mm. So you can see my ... discouragement, yes?

Fields.MenuText: If I tell you to work harder, will you believe that I mean it?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe. It sounds less like you than one might think, Capitaine.
... Merci, Capitain.
We have some big shoes to fill, Capitaine.
How goes the rest of the ship?
Well... I've got the week's reports here.
... Don't need to do anything about that... or that...
What's this last one? It looks like it was typed in a hurry....
Oh. Do you remember when the motors cut out last night?
Mmhm. You told me there was nothing to worry about...?
Our Belle had to stop controlling the ship and type this up. ...She was apologetic, but she thought you'd want to know.
"Repport on teh Mrorgana compeasses? "
She was in a hurry. Do you want the short version?
Please. This is borderline unreadable.
She doesn't *think* the Morgana compasses had anything to do with our little mist problem. She thinks she'd be able to tell.
Well, *that's* a relief. I was beginning to think things might make sense.
... We agreed to let U-29 hold onto it. She's interested enough in mysterious oddities that she might get something out of it...
... And enough of a stubborn little cuss not to hand it over to her superiors?
Exactement. Which is more than we can say for some of the Allied Belles.
If she can uncover its secrets, she will, and you'll be the first to know.
And if she can't, it's more likely to wind up on the ocean floor than in the wrong hands.
*ALARM*
... Let's make sure we don't wind up on the ocean floor. Help me to the bridge, Yeoman?
Already on it, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
THIS IS THE END.
...Get out of my head.
You'll never be rid of me, Captain.
Yes, I will. Go away.
I am inevitable.
You really aren't.
Captain? None of my business, but who were you talking to?
... Nnn. Fever dreams. Same as the rest of us.
... You too, huh? Which one are you....?
... Despair. She was the first one I ever... ran into.
Bad luck, huh....
We could have run into worse.
*COUGH* I keep seeing Delusion.

Fields.MenuText: Does she mix better with the pink elephants?
You want to trade?

Fields.DialogueText: Not a chance.
*COUGH* I wish I was getting pink elephants.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry to hear that. She's a nasty one.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to- *COUGH*- tell me twice.
... Was she your first?
Nn. She's the one- *COUGH*- I'm most tempted to listen to.
Really?
It's the certainty. She *knows* everything. ...Until she knows something else.
In a way, you could say that about Despair, too.
Mmm. She knows everything's doomed?
Mmhm. And the longer this war goes...
This new business with the mist. Ugh.
I don't like it either, Captain. If they have a way to neutralize Belles...

Fields.MenuText: ... This could be a much shorter war than any of us would hope for, yes.
... We could have just had a run of bad luck.
... I'm more worried about them neutralizing the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, yeah. But they'd never have gotten to the crew without... y'know. Mist.
If it's *just* bad luck, I'll eat my hat. And Orest's, too.
I don't even want to think about that right now.  Urgh.
Whatever's going to happen, we're going to have the world's brightest minds on it. As fast as we can.
I've already got a report written up. And our Belle's editing it as we speak.
To make sure it's coherent, and to make sure no one panics.
We're gonna have an uphill battle with that. Especially if the rest of the world's been hit as hard as we have.
Imagine what the Baltic must look like right now.
Don't even say that. I hear Despair knocking again.
This is how it ends...
*ALARM*
Oh, go to *hell*. -- Not you, McPhee.
I didn't say anything, Captain.
@BATTLE
Back already, my friend? My, my. You don't have to pretend to be sick to come visit, you know - the doctor won't ask questions as long as you bring him his single malt.
... Stop making fun of me.
I would, if you didn't make it so easy.
There's nothing funny about this situation.
Ah, but there is, friend. You try to drag yourself out to the radio room at least once a day...
And you're inevitably brought back on a stretcher an hour later, babbling Morgana nonsense.
--It's pathetic, is what it is. I can do so much more--
Ah, yes, because knocking on Death's door is the best way to get what you want.
Rich coming from you.
I don't knock on Death's door! I'm simply thrown into it, repeatedly, by circumstance and awful luck.
I might as well have been born there, Lugin. The least I can do is use it to get what I want.
Mm, and this definitely will not backfire on you.
... You think I'm just going back to work for the fun of it?
I think you think this ship will stop sailing if you leave your radio chair.
It's not like that.
Then what is it like, comrade?
... Did you know there's a Belle who's a medic?
I heard something like that. My friend swore she gave him a tattoo in Ibiza...
... Your friends have such *interesting* stories.
I don't claim it's true. But it's what I've heard.
... Either way. I'm trying to contact her. If she knows how to cure Disease's disease....
And how's that working out for you?
I keep getting Morgana chatter.
And while you do your best impression of a fly on a windshield, I am finally getting my vacation. *That's* what's funny.
You call this a vacation?
A bed that I don't have to share, three meals I don't have to work for, and suggestible young men to bring me cigarettes? I'm living the life of an Arabian prince.
You're in the hospital.
And? Where is the contradiction?
Ugh. I'm getting up. *This* time, I'll get to her.
*ALARM*
We've got hostiles inbound. Everyone back in your beds, and brace for impact.
Let me get back to the radio room, Kapitan. Please-

Fields.MenuText: Not on your life.
Back to bed, Cassel. That's an order.
Do you want to crack your skull open?

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't yet.
... Jawohl.
We're not giving you the chance. Back to bed.
You need someone in the radio room--
Our Belle can cover for you. You need to recover.
-- Stop smirking.
I said nothing.
You were thinking something.
When even our Kapitan wants you to rest...
... Spare me.
@BATTLE
Glad to see you up and about again, Capitain.
Glad to be up and about again. How are you holding up?
Relieved to be, well, relieved of the burdens of command.
I'm happy to carry that burden. --How are we holding up?
Doctor van Geffen's been bedridden. The Doctor's been taking care of her.
... That's just what we need. A medic out of commission.
... I thought you should know... in her delirium, she said something about "her wife."

Fields.MenuText: Poor woman. She must be out of her head.
...That explains a lot, but if she's still bedridden, we have bigger problems.
Good for her.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not so sure. She's mentioned a housemate a few times.
Oh, you don't have to tell me. We've been hurting for medics since *before* Disease hit.
Was that sarcasm, Capitaine?
Why are you telling me this?
I've got no call to judge anyone's personal life... but if she's keeping a secret like that, she'd be easy to blackmail.
Ah. You're Bertie's daughter.
Pf. I'm a realist, c'est tout.
Listen, Yeoman...
I'm listening, but I won't like what you have to say, will I?

Fields.MenuText: If Van Geffen's completely out of commission, we have *much* bigger problems.
Have you looked at your female crewmates? Recently?
People say all kinds of things when they have a fever.

Fields.DialogueText: They do. What are you implying?
Van Geffen's a good woman, a good doctor, and she's been discreet about her personal life.
Some of us have been talking to our dead parents. Some of us have been talking to Morganas. None of us have any room to judge.
....Not the way you're implying, no.
Half of them have a girl at home. The other half have a girl in every port.
... Ah, oui. I see what you mean.
And I understand that. I'm just... I can't help it. It's the way my mind works.
I understand *that*. But I'm asking you to take off your reporter hat and put on your yeoman hat.
I'm not judging her, Capitain. I have no room to talk either. But--
This isn't my problem, Savary. Don't make it my problem.
If it ever *becomes* your problem--
Then I'm sure you'll tell me so. At length.
You know me so well.
*ALARM*
Now this *is* my problem.
And I'm certain you'll deal with it with your usual panache.
@BATTLE
... Augie. I thought you'd never show up.
I got held up. There were some Morgana transmissions coming in--
Ughhhhhhhhhhhh.
--And I had to recalibrate the radio to tune them out.
And that took you a week?
Ja, wirklich.
It's been six days and you haven't come to see me once.
For the first few days, I was sick too--
Sure--
And then I was trying to radio that Belle medic--
Mochiron, but--
So I'm sorry I haven't had time to come see you--
SHUT UP! Shut up. Shut UP!
I don't care! Okay? I don't care why you didn't come see me. You could be Superman and spend your entire life saving cats from trees-
... Dare I ask?
You really could be saving the world every day. And it wouldn't *matter*.
It matters if there isn't a world to live in when we're done!
That's not your job! Not all on your own!
If I don't put in the work--
Someone else will!
That's not how it works!
Then how does it work? Ignoring your lover who's on her deathbed?
I haven't been - They've needed-
They haven't! They really really haven't!
I don't understand how you can be so selfish. At a time like this...
Selfish?! *Selfish?!*
Yes. ... I understand you were in... a bad place, but...
... There are things that are bigger than either of us. So big that you can't understand them.
I understand just fine, Mister "I can't look at the stars anymore."
.... You know, I've spent my entire life trying to impress people who couldn't see me.
All of them were worried about something *bigger* than me.
The whole world's on our shoulders. The least I can do is carry my part.
And you know what? They might have been right. I'm not important. Not the way you or our Belle or -- or the Captain are.
Maybe if I was someone would give a damn. But I'm not.
... I'm tired, August. I'm tired of being the last thing on anyone's mind.
Just for once. Just one time. I want someone to choose me first. Because I matter.
You do matter. But I want to have a world to love you in--
You have a funny way of showing it.
... I can't take this anymore, August.  You ignore me, and ignore me, and ignore me. And I'm done trying to get people's attention.
Sayako--
*ALARM*
Sayako! Sayako, please-
... Go save the world. I don't care anymore.
You have my attention, I promise-
You can't lie to me like that, August. We're through.
@BATTLE
I'm fine. You really don't have to fuss over me.
Woman, you have not seen fussing yet. You fuss. I attend.
Mm- *COUGH, COUGH*
Ah, the woman of the hour. --You don't mind if I stand in the doorway?
Not at all. I might still be contagious.
Whatever it is, I've already gotten it.
Unfortunately- *COUGH* - Unfortunately for us all, diseases mutate.
And this ship is a petri dish. We've got the perfect conditions- *COUGH*

Fields.MenuText: Gotcha. I'll stay in the doorway.
Maybe we should wear face masks until this is over. They do it in China.
Do you think we'll need to quarantine?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd have to get the crew to wear them first.
If the mist is causing this, every ship in the world might have to.
Let's hope that's enough.
Easier said than done.
It probably won't be.
Let's hope it doesn't come to that.
... It's good to see you looking so healthy. You're sitting up and everything.
*WHEEZE* *COUGH*
Maybe she shouldn't be.
Maybe- *COUGH* I'm just allergic to your nonsense.
If you were, you'd have gone into anaphylaxis by now.
Urgh.
*ALARM*
Ah, I'd better get moving. Good luck.
Mm. Shouldn't I be telling *you* that?
You're the one who has to heal from this plague.
@BATTLE
-- and once again, we say, damn it all!
You gonna sing for us this time?
... Not in the mood, sensei.
The Captain's showed up. That makes this a special occasion.
... I dragged myself out of bed and to your party so that I could have a drink.
I'm not really in the mood to sing...

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything we can do to cheer you up?
Aww, but you promised.
I didn't know you were part of the Club.

Fields.DialogueText: About as much as you are.
I did promise. And I can't keep that promise. Just like everyone else on this stupid ship...
... Well, there is one thing.... but you're gonna make that face about it.
Lugin-san dragged me here last time. He said that I looked like a wet cat...
I keep my promises.
About that.
Which face?
The one where you look like you just ate a lemon.
You kind of have...
... What's on your mind, Kirishima?
I need to get out there, that's what. That would fix me.
"Get out there?"
With a boarding party.
We've been over this...
We have! And you told me that I could. I've been training with the Marines--
Wait, what?
I know that if I'm ever on a boarding party, I'm going to need to work with them. So we've been practicing maneuvers and tactics-
So you can stay out of their way?
Other way round, Kanchou!
*LOUD AND OBVIOUSLY FAKE COUGHING*
Ah, the man of the hour! How are you feeling?
@BATTLE
Absolutely wasting away, my friends. This may be the last time you ever see me.
I just gave you a clean bill of health, you malingerer.
I'm in a wheelchair. Pushed around like an invalid.
By your partner in crime!
Hey, I'm just here for the cachaça.
Plenty of that, but no music.
You're not going to convince me, sensei...
We need a singer? Why didn't you say so?
Where've you been? The party couldn't start without you.
Working. Van Geffen needs more nurses than she's got.
Hey, don't look at me like that. I'm a doctor, not a nurse.
I said what I said. You want me to sing? Pour a glass.
Will do.
*clears throat*
J′ai deux amants, c'est beaucoup mieux... Car je fais croire à chacun d′eux...
Ughhh. I hate her.
Mm? What'd she do this time?
Here she is singing about having two lovers... right in front of me.
... I don't think she's doing it at you.
Still hurts...
Enfin, a moment of-
*ALARM*
... I honestly thought that only happened to the Capitaine.
Ah, solnyshko. ...You're not looking too sunny.
Ja nai. ... Can I have a cigarette?
You ask that of a man on his very deathbed?
I ask it of my friend.
I suppose I can spare *one*. For my friend.
Do itashimashte.
... The sea's calm toni-
Don't you even.
Very well. The sea is a raging beast carefully disguised as-
I don't want to talk about the weather. Or the water.
Then what do you want to talk about?
I don't really want to talk.
Good. Then you can sit back and listen to my amazing stories.
... I've been thinking about what you said. About the curse of wisdom.
Razve? Again?
... It's worth it, trying to understand the universe. Isn't it?
Ahhh. You're not going to get the answer you want from me.
... I didn't think so.
The world's a cruel place. Nobody gets to understand all of it.
... I know. It's just more complicated than that.
You've been talking to "Augie" again, haven't you?
... We broke up three days ago.
Ah. Congratulations?
... Yeah, some of the things he said have been getting to me. But he's being really stupid about everything.
You did just break up.
That doesn't mean I don't have eyes!
Da, da. Of course you do. It's just--
Just what?
How do I put this.
Do you think he's wrong because he's wrong, or because you hate him?
Both!
... Chew on it for longer. Once you've calmed down, you might agree with him.
... Hmmm. I just realized...
Oh? A moment of revelation?
Something like that. You're out of your wheelchair, aren't you?
As perceptive as ever. Kolya has things to do, and I --

Fields.MenuText: I knew you were malingering.
Lugin? A word?
I thought you needed a wheelchair.

Fields.DialogueText: *LOUD, FAKE COUGHING* Oh- Kapitan-
*LOUD, FAKE COUGHING* Of- of course-
*LOUD, FAKE COUGHING* Kapitan! I - *COUGH* I can assure you-
I'm willing to give you the benefit of the doubt, but there's enough sick folks aboard that--
I am *wasting away*, Kapitan.
I'm... just gonna go. Ganbatte, Lugin-san-
Solnyshko, wait- I never gave you a light-
He sure can run for being on his deathbed.
I'm not sure which of them is faster.
If I was a betting man... I'd put money on the girl.
@BATTLE
You don't want to be my friend, solnyshko! I borrow *much* more from my friends than I do from random coworkers. Much better to know me as the cloud on the distant horizon, the-
Just give me the cigarette.
Stop being awful.
Bah! I will make no such promise.
But tell Uncle Oreshek all about it if it makes you feel better.
*sigh* Here we go again.
We got another report from Wegryzyn?
The plane guy, yep. He's been keeping track of the raids over Rio de Janiero. -- It's not good.
It never is. What're we dealing with?
Well. The "good" news is that we've got less of those bug planes.

Fields.MenuText: I don't see a downside.
So what's the catch?
Does that mean we've thinned out Infestation some?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, I'm getting to that.
Hate to say, there's a pretty big one.
Don't know. It's not like anyone's keeping a census.
Maybe we should get Savary on that.
Fire away, then.
The catch is, we've seen more planes dropping Morgana propaganda, and they *don't* look like Infestation's.
Oh, no. You're not telling me...
It's in the report, but to sum up--
They've looked like mailplanes. Mostly American and British. Boeings, Boulton Pauls, that kind of thing.
But they're dropping Morgana propaganda?
Yep. It's the same garbage we saw back in the Baltic. Reads like it was written by a hamster on a bender.
... The stuff no one with half a brain would believe? That's a relief.
Yeah. I'm not scared of what they're dropping, I'm scared of what's dropping it.
Because they're human planes?
Or a damn good imitation.
That's... worrying. We found any tells yet?
Wegryzyn says his plane nut friends are working on it, but... so far, the only way to tell is when you shoot one down.
... Because they have Morgana guts.
Mmm. And of course, it's not like we can shoot down every mail plane we see.
I don't even want to think about the implications.
But we're all gonna have to.
... I'm just imagining the worst-case scenario. A Disease that looks like an ordinary ocean liner. Sails right past you.
I know. I think I might never sleep again.
You've been sleeping?
*ALARM*
At least we know where we stand with these ones.
They look as ugly as they are inside?
Something like that.
@BATTLE
... all the bad luck in this town has found me....
You Dammitalls are persistent, I'll give you that.
Persistent like the mumps.
Painful and hard to swallow?
Something like that.
Who wouldn't want to drown their sorrows on a night like this?
I would have thought things were getting better for you. Most of the crew has a clean bill of health.
Most.

Fields.MenuText: ... But not your best friend, huh?
You're worried about the local star-crossed lovebirds?
Our "invalid" looks awfully healthy to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah! If I *ever* worry about him, take away my medical license.
That man's a cockroach. He'll outlive all of us.
... Not medically speaking, no. Someone should probably give that boy a talk, though.
It's none of my business. Until it becomes a problem.
... You mean Gretta?
I was being ironic, but yes. She's under the weather, isn't she?
You're gunning for understatement of the century here...
... It's van Geffen, Captain. If you must know.
Ah, I'm sorry to hear that.
It's the damnedest thing. Half the crew bounced back from the brink of death in three days.
The kid's up smoking and hassling you about going on a boarding mission....
She's... resilient. I'll give her that.
... But there's too many people who just... didn't recover at all. Anywhere from death's door to... just ailing.
(This is how it ends...)
It'd be hard enough if it was just sailors, but ...
Sometimes you never realize how much you rely on someone til they're out of commission.
And "someone" is still sick?
Like a dog.
It's all mild symptoms. I wouldn't be scared for her, but... nothing we do is alleviating them.
She couldn't be in better hands.
If you're gonna give me cold comfort, at least put it on the rocks.
*ALARM*
What a way to break up the club.
When I get low... ohhhhhhh, I get high!
Anything you need in port, Cassel?
... Ach. I can't think of anything.
Well, you've got an hour or so to think about it. We're making landfall in Montevideo...
... There's only one thing I want and you can't give it to me.
*sigh*
So no, Kapitan, I don't want anything in port.
... Well, I've got some good news for you.
We've found another radio operator who can take up the slack.
... I don't need help.
She comes highly recommended. I heard she can get a signal from Florida all the way in the Falklands.
... You don't need to take any weight off me. I'm fine, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: You're clearly not. Don't lie to me.
I trust your judgement, but...

Fields.DialogueText: ... I can handle it. Please don't take this away from me.
But? How many days have I covered the radio now?
Yes, that's the problem.
I'm not discharging you, Cassel. We still need you as much as ever.
... Please don't take this away from me.
At this point... saving the world with you... it's all I've got.
Bit all-or-nothing there, huh?
... You don't understand.
She says her secret's her whistling. Helps her find the right frequency or something.
I think I understand better than you do.
You're a good man. You're conscientious. To a fault.
You work hard. Too hard.
It's the least I can do. The world's a mess, and--
And you are not obligated to fix it on your own.
I'm obligated to try to fix it. What else is there for us?
... You work harder than I do, and I have an entire support staff taking parts of the job off my shoulders.
You don't have Belles, Cassel.
I don't -- Listen--
What?
There's nothing left for me out there. Everything got destroyed in that first attack.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry for your losses, but--
A lot of us lost as much.
I know. It's been hard for you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the understatement of the century.
I know. I'm not trying to claim that I've somehow suffered more than anyone else.
Danke. But it... you see what I'm saying?
I keep saying it but you're not listening. There's nothing left for me but my work.
If I don't throw myself at it... I start wanting to listen to the whispers.
... We're going to get you some more help, whether you like it or not.
... Jawohl, Kapitan. But surely-
No buts.
*ALARM*
As long as they're out in force, you *can't* make me take a break.
I can try. But -- get to your station.
Danke schön.
@BATTLE
So let me get this straight.
We're not going to be able to dock in Rio de Janiero.
For about six good reasons, yes.
Lay it on me.
The biggest one is that... well, Brazil's government isn't too happy with us...
Santa Catarina?
Got it in one.
Poor girl. Wherever she is, I hope she found some peace.
Me too.
Do you think he'll see reason?
Northern Brazil's getting hammered. They've got the US helping them patrol, but...
The Caribbean is still a clown show?
Venom's put on the red nose and wig.

Fields.MenuText: Well, we've got to get past them. Hopefully we don't make trouble.
You made it sound like there were more problems.
If she thinks she's funny, we're about to be hilarious.

Fields.DialogueText: Ain't we always.
There are. They're just my division, not his.
Captain, you can't say that with a straight face.
I can try.
Sorry to interrupt. We have bigger fish to fry, Captain.
... You're not laughing.
Is Van Geffen the one in the frying pan?
Don't.
... It's that bad?
She's fading fast. If I didn't know better, I'd say she had the Black Plague.
"If you didn't know better?"
Yesterday night, she started developing dark growths along her lymph nodes. Throat, armpits, you know.
... And you're sure that's *not* the Black Plague?
Yes, Captain. She's not necrotic--
Thank goodness.
It's worse. There's something growing beneath her skin. It almost looks...
Metallic. The growths have sharp edges. It's no natural disease.
You think she's contagious?
I don't know, but I'm not going to find out the hard way.
I want to send her to a hospital, but if we can't stop in Rio...
Do you think anyone will take her?
If we can't even lay anchor, I doubt they're gonna do us a favor.
... So that's how it's gonna be, huh?
We're still heading north. We have to tell as many people as possible what we saw in Antarctica.
Course, Captain.
I just hope we can do it quickly enough to save van Geffen's--
*ALARM*
-- life.
Save our lives first, Captain.
@BATTLE
... But, yeah. President Vargas is calling for another investigation, Germany's threatening to support it. We're not welcome.
Glad to see you up on your own two feet.
Ah... It wasn't really my choice, Kapitan. I'm still languishing. Doomed, even.
Just your luck.
Ponimayesh... My bad luck will be the end of us all. Just you wait.
Mmhm. Is your "bad luck" why you're chained to the bar?
No, that's for good luck.

Fields.MenuText: Well, we could definitely use that...
That makes no sense.
So you're the scapegoat?

Fields.DialogueText: I think we might have taken more of our share. The universe is out of balance.
I'm glad you see it that way. Unfortunately, they gave our grumpy friend the key.
And chaining you to the bar balances it?
If I was, they'd have pushed me overboard by now.
It's more of a bottle-on-the-floor scenario.
That's an old Russian tradition, isn't it? You put your empty bottles on the floor to ward off bad luck?
Because you're their lucky rabbit's foot?
It's bad luck to put them on the table. And I cannot think of an emptier bottle...
*ALARM*
Are you going to set me free now, Kapitan?
I don't have the key. CASSEL--
So I will cling to alcohol for dear life?
Blyat. No different from every other day, really...
@BATTLE
-- So that's what we found. It's worse than anyone thought.
I see why you didn't want to discuss this over the radio.
Indeed. It's sensitive information.
Can't have the civilians panic, right?
I want this news to spread as far as it can. Through official channels.
You've come to the right woman. My patrol route takes me past everywhere that matters south of the Caribbean.
Thank you.
I just wish you went north of the Caribbean. We need to get this news spread as wide as we can...
... Oooh, I hope none of your Belles are listening in.
*Some* of them wouldn't make the obvious joke.
My girl would. I love Chateau Thierry but she's got such a filthy mind...
There's one in every fleet.
Say, that's got me thinking...
You should talk to Admiral Nash, if you can. He's a good man. Well-connected...

Fields.MenuText: And what does this have to do with dirty-minded Belles?
Mmhm, and we need that right now...
We've tried to get in touch with him a few times...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, your drunk radio operator?
He isn't drunk.
He was slurring his words all over the place--
I can't remember the last time he slept. The man's too dedicated.
His connections are helpful. But his Belle's even better.
Is that so?
Mmm. Makes sense. Well, either way, if you can get a hold of the Admiral...
Every fleet has its dirty-minded girl... and every fleet has its gossip.
And Admiral Nash has our gossip?
His flagship's a blabbermouth. She shares every bit of news she gets, no matter how improbable...
Ah. An unofficial emergency alert system...
... To be honest, I already heard this one. I just didn't trust it coming from Ms. Loose Lips Sink Ships.
"...This one"?
The Morganas building something in the Weddell sea. Something big.
But it was third or fourthhand at that point, and she's said some nuttier things.
Well, the rumours are true.
... I've heard worse news this week, but not by much.
Mm. ...So I get in touch with Admiral Nash, he spreads the information unofficially, and his Belle spreads it through their grapevine.
Sounds about right.
*ALARM*
Dammit. It's like they know when you're having an important conversation.
Well, we've got the firepower to deal with them. Ready for a fight?
Born ready.
@BATTLE
Docteur. You *cannot* convince me that you do not know what's happening.
Because you're stubborn as a j- a mule.
Stubborn, oui. Stupid, non.
It's stupid to ask the same question over and over if you'll get the same answer.
You're hiding *something*.
You know something you're not telling me. And I'm going to get my answer.
I'm not hiding a diagnosis. I don't *have* a diagnosis.
If I had one, you'd be the first to know, *Miss Sue Barton*.
Your sarcasm can go straight to hell.
I thought you *liked* sarcasm.
It's a weapon I like wielding. I don't like it turned on me.
Too bad. As long as you insist on playing nurse--
This isn't a game! Or a joke.
You sure? Because from the way you're acting--
Gretta is my *friend*.
--I could swear you were a rich kid slumming it.
Non. My father was rich. I've had to settle for hard work.
You have no idea what you're doing.
Because you won't tell me what's going on! I'm starting to think you don't either!
Whoa, whoa, I hear shouting. What's going on?
The doctor's hiding crucial information--
Yes, from an uninformed civilian who is messing with dangerous, contagious diseases-
QUIET. BOTH OF YOU.

Fields.MenuText: The Doctor's right. You don't know what you're playing with.
If you want her to stop "messing with" things, you've got a lost cause.
It doesn't matter who's "right." You're in the damn sick bay.

Fields.DialogueText: Mais je ne peut pas--
But she can't just--
I know better than either of you think I do!
For the sake of *our* patients... Let's take it down a notch.
Yeoman Savary's resilient. If you're going to stop her, you're going to need to chloroform her and lock her back in that crate.
S'il vous plait, do *not* remind me of the worst thing that's ever happened to me.
You're a journalist, not a nurse.
Now. What's going on here? Why are you two shouting? Other than the obvious.
Our good docteur's trying to dissuade me from taking care of Gretta.
She doesn't know what she's asking. It's *dangerous* work-
Je m’en fiche. I want to give her pain medication and keep her hydrated. How is that dangerous?
...The buboes are Morgana matter. They're... living metal. When I tried to remove one...
... You look like someone just walked over your grave.
It might have been my grave, if I hadn't gotten lucky.
When I lanced it, it squirted pus. Gunmetal grey, burned like acid.
My coat and the bedding are still full of holes. If I'd been any less careful, so would my face.
... So I won't try to lance them.
It gets worse. There's a reason she's been in so much pain.
And pray tell, what is that reason?
...The Morgana ... stuff... is burning all the analgesics out of her system.
If you give her pain medication, it's neutralized in seconds. Doesn't matter whether it's opioids or ether or aspirin.
You see why I didn't want you doing anything.
You see why I thought you were hiding something.
*ALARM*
You sorted it out? Go secure your patients.
Oui, Capitain.
We haven't sorted it, but ...
Get to work, now.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
They're letting us dock? I don't get it.
I thought Brazil wasn't letting us in. ...This is still Brazil, right?
Our Belles have been busting hump, but they're not *that* fast.
We made it to São Luís, and they're going to let us in.
Oh! Already? Huh, I ... I thought that'd take a couple more days...
Mmhm. We're only a couple thousand clicks from Grenada.
And that's where we can talk to that admiral, right?
Yep. ...Say, Kirishima...
Mm?
You really meant it about the boarding party? Even when you were that sick?
Of course I did.
... I wouldn't have sent you. You know that, right?
But you promised--
Wouldn't. When you were that sick.
Oh. Well, I'm healthy now. Full of energy, even!
Mmhm. Sure you are.
I mean it. I feel good enough to go into port when we go.
Ah, Lugin told me that you had plans...
... So what if I did?
He told me you asked him to make a deal with one of his friends... to trade some contraband.
And what's the problem with that? You let him make deals all the time.
I've never heard him make a deal about a contraband cat.
He told you the details?!
All the details. Including the part where he thinks you're getting scammed.
It's not like that, Kanchou. Someone found a cat that they said they rescued from a sinking Morgana...

Fields.MenuText: Sure they did. I bet they rescued Princess Elizabeth and the Pope, too.
If it's not like that, what is it like?
You really must love cats.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a little more of a dog person, but... they're cute! And besides, this is important.
It's in the interest of both science and common decency!
If they had, you would have heard about it by now. It's just a cat. But...
... Go on.
If they're not scamming me, and the Morganas really did do something to this cat, studying it is necessary for the progress of science.
And if they didn't?
If they didn't, then I'm getting scammed. Do you really want a scam artist doing this to a cat?
But ...  There's been more Morgana nastiness, since the INPF can't patrol. Thousands of casualities in Peru....
That's awful...
It is, but it means their president backed down.
I guess it can't be helped.

Fields.MenuText: All right, but have someone come with you. I don't want you getting shot.
It's too big of a risk. I can't allow it.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou....
We'll get you a cat that isn't an abomination against nature. Somewhere that isn't being menaced by Morganas.
You're no fun.
Hontoni arigatou gozaimas!
You're really excited about this, aren't you?
Of course! Cats and science! It's the best combina-
*ALARM*
Kirishima--
I'll get to my station. If I'm dismissed?
Would you listen if I formally--
Aaand... she's gone.
@BATTLE
It's the same damn dream every time, isn't it?
Is there anywhere else you can go?
Anywhere you can run, little human?

Fields.MenuText: I hear the Bahamas are lovely, this time of year.
Have the decency not to play with your food.
You know there isn't. But you know this isn't real.

Fields.DialogueText: We're going to consume them. And you, too.
I'm not Mischief. You would know if I was playing with you.
Perceptive, Captain. But does it matter? Your waking world isn't real, either.
... Look. Cut the crap. What is it you *want*?
Isn't it obvious?
No! No, it's not obvious!
When humans go to war, it's because we *want* something so much they don't care who they hurt to get it.
We want land or power or revenge. That, I could understand.
All you do is tear things up and make them part of you. You don't *want* anything.
We want a reckoning.
What?
We want a reckoning. An apocalypse. A restitution.  A conclusion.
And no matter what you do, you're going to give it to us. Because ...
If you say "this is how it ends", I'm going to kill you.
You can't kill an idea, Captain.
*EVIL LAUGHTER, LOUD AS AN ALARM*
*GASP*
This is the last time I eat that much right before bed...
@BATTLE
Oh... Marie-France...
... August? Your headache getting the better of you again?
No, I... *hic*
I've been thinking.
You've been drinking.
I've been thinking... that I need to pay attention... to the people who are important to me...
Mon dieu. Where do you think your hands are going?
Your shoulder. I'd never-- unless you want-- I mean--
Cassel. Non.
You are not going to do anything to me that you'd regret. Drunk, or sober.
I wouldn't regret... you're pretty. And ... I...
Yes, you would.
You're a one-woman man, and your woman just left.
*hic* ... Sayako...
... Bordel de merde. Youuuu are not in possession of your senses.
I... I wanna cry when I think about her... and I don't wanna think about her. I want...
What do you want?
I don't want to be alone!
... Ah, Yeoman. Am I interrupting something?
Not at all, Capitain. What do you need?
We've finally gotten in contact with the Germans. They've sent a trade delegation to Brazil--
And you need someone to help you parley?
More or less. I also need someone to help me root out the spies.
Consider me there.
Marie-France-- wait--

Fields.MenuText: Cassel-- go get some sleep.
Stop embarrassing yourself.
You're better than this, Cassel.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I don't... wanna...
That's an order.
@BATTLE
Get to your stations, people! Incoming!
@BATTLE
And so the most unlikely Damn It All Club convenes.
... It's you and me. And you chained yourself to the bar.
At this point, I'd do much worse for luck.
I'm more surprised to see you here. I thought you didn't drink.
... I don't. Didn't. It makes the headaches worse, and...
I don't like the person I am when I drink. But...
But the best cure for a lonely heart is a hangover?
Something like that.
You don't sound convinced.
... It's not just the situation with Sayako. If it was just her... I think I'd survive it.
Then what's the problem? Savary break your heart too?
... Please don't remind me that happened. I'd rather take a bottle to the face.
Too bad. I'm not wasting any.
Mm. ...It's ... *Everything's* got me unmoored. You know?
Better unmoored than anchored?
Maybe for you.
Before all this hit... I had a place in the world. And now I don't. And I don't know what to do about that.
I thought you didn't like your old life.
I hated it! I was a salesman for my father's diamond business. I hate diamonds. And sales.
And your father?
Ah, Herr Freud.  I didn't know you came aboard!
I asked because it might be ... you have many things in common with friends of mine.
... My father died in the first attack on Amsterdam.
Ah.
No one knows what to say to that. It's fine.
(holds up a glass) May his memory be a blessing.
.... Danke.
You know what it's like to lose your father? I can't... Especially since he was so...
For years, my life revolved around what he wanted. And I'll never be able to ask him what he wants again.
... There's always an empty space there, isn't there?
...An empty space?
At first it's only half-empty. You wish you could put someone better there. A pirate, maybe. A hero.
But then he's *gone*, and it's just... empty. There will never be anything there again.
... You do understand.
No, I'm just talking bullshit. But what else can you do in times like these?
... My whole life's that space now. And I don't know how to fill it back up. I tried work. I tried love.
And it's all blown up in your face. Because you don't know how to quit.
... You didn't ask for my advice, but I'll give it. Don't try.
Helpful.
I mean it. The more you try to fill it, the emptier it feels.
If you keep moving... and don't worry about that emptiness too much... you'll get away from it.
It will be a funny skeleton you keep in the closet and dress in costumes when you want to drag it out again.
... You haven't gotten away from it, though.
My entire closet is full of skeletons. Someday I should introduce you to one or two of them.
... You're the last person I should have asked for advice...
But you came to get it from me, because you know I'm right. But if you'd rather just commit slow suicide by overwork, have at it!
Go f-
Oh, are you sure? I'll check on them. Of course.
You two okay? Our Belle said someone chained Lugin to the bar again.
Ah, everything's fine, Kapitan! It's the old good luck charm.

Fields.MenuText: If you two are going to fight again, take it outside.
...All right, I'll trust you.
....Well, it's none of my business.

Fields.DialogueText: Assuredly not! But here we are.
A terrible choice, but one I thank you for making!
We weren't fighting! We were having a very serious, man-to-man conversation. Weren't we, Cassel?
... I'm just going to go.
Enjoy your skeletons, Lugin.
Everybody ready? Let's work off some frustration.
I was just reflecting on the contrast. You left home when your old man was gone. I left home to get away from mine.
Says something profound about both of us, no doubt.
*ALARM*
McPhee, report! What's the situation?
You remember how Brazil closed its waters to the INPF?
For all of five minutes, yes.
Well, that gave the Morganas time to mass to the south...
... And they're coming this way.
I figure we'll meet them somewhere close to Rio, barring any curve balls. And we've got a real fight ahead of us, Captain.
Don't we always. Any complications? Other than the number.
Savvy as ever, Captain.
Remember Santa Catarina?
How could I ever forget?
The Morg armada's got two or three ships that move like her. ...And worse...
How does it get worse?
... They look to be civilian ships.
.... A couple fishing trawlers, a tugboat, a merchant ship. All crawling with--
-- They armed?
Negative, Captain. A few of them look to have their crew aboard.

Fields.MenuText: That's horrible. ....
... It can't be helped.
Is there anything Morganas won't stoop to?

Fields.DialogueText: I wish I had your stoicism.
Makes me sick too.
If there is, I haven't seen it.
... From a tactical standpoint, they won't be an issue. None of them are armed.
And we can gun them down before they get in infesting range.
Tactically, yeah. That's the right call.
... They're using civilians as cannon fodder.
The realities of war, I guess.
It's not just callous. It's frightening. They're getting smarter.
They've always used shock tactics.
Yeah. But now they know what will shock us.
@BATTLE
I'm still picking up transmissions, Kapitan. There's another wave coming!
Any more civilians?
Nein.
Then make every bullet count!
@BATTLE
... It's over.
I can't believe you did it. For a second there, I thought...
We did it. They're safe. For now, at least.
I'm already getting wires from Brazilian newspapers. How did they find out so quickly...?
Must have heard the shooting stop.
Bravo, Captain. Bra-goddamn-vo.
Hey, what's with that tone?
You're the bloody hero, *again*. Fantastic.
You save the goddamn world, sure, but you can't save....
... She's fading fast. There's nothing I can do.
Maybe if you'd been there... you're like a good luck charm.

Fields.MenuText: I'm a normal person. I couldn't save her any more than you.
It's Easter. Maybe we pray for a miracle.
She still might pull through.

Fields.DialogueText: I know what I'm looking at, Captain. There's no way she's making it out of this. She's not getting enough oxygen.
.... If I had that kind of faith, she might have made it.
You keep saving us through impossible odds. Maybe you could have...
Let's not lose hope yet. Can we radio the mainland, see if we can get another doctor? Maybe someone else has seen this--
I can't do it. I don't think anyone can. It's too... too...
Kapitan! We're getting a weird signal.
It's on the frequency Morganas usually use, but... it sounds like a Belle.
Patch her through.
Capitaine. I hear you need a doctor.
Not that I need to tell you this, Kapitan, but don't mention the... small crafts.
Are you kidding? We only just smoothed over the last one.
Docteur, I know you don't want to hear this. But you're going to have to operate.
... How do I even know you are who you say you are? No one's talked to that Belle Doctor face to face--
You don't. You may never know. But this is the only way I can talk to you. You have to trust me.
Look - What do I call you again?
Malheureusement, a degree of operational secrecy is required. "The Monster" will suffice.
Look. "Monster." I can't do this. The last time it happened, I-
Your hand slipped. You told me this.
Yes. And the metal inside spread.
I can't let her die. But even a tiny slip...
Come, now. You're braver than this.
I'm not! I'm really, really not!
If you weren't, you wouldn't be here right now. Cowards don't become military doctors.
Maybe I was never good enough to be here. All right?!
I can't do a goddamn precision operation on a goddamn boat in the middle of a goddamn typhoon.
It needs to come out.
You think I don't know that?!
They're not buboes. They're not conventional wounds. They're weapons under the skin.
... I don't...
They're still active ordinance. They're constantly generating the Morgana taint. If you don't excise and neutralize them...
... I give her a week. At best.
You know what you have to do, Docteur. Don't delay.
Sorry, I couldn't help but overhear...
Ah, Capitaine. What do you want?
Can I maybe suggest a compromise?
What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: If the Doctor is right... and I'm not saying he is...
We don't have any experience with this disease. You clearly do.
We may not have a choice but to rely on you.

Fields.DialogueText: Disease is my sworn enemy.
You can't even believe me when I doubt myself?
Then least of all.
... We might need to request your help.
I have duties of my own to fulfill.
I know. And I'd never dream of telling you to neglect them.
You don't have a choice but to ask. Is that it?
Something like that, yes.
... I make no promises. But if I can, I'll assist.
*ALARM*
I have my duties, and you have yours. Go.
Thank you, "Monster." We won't forget this.
Live long enough to remember.
@BATTLE
I can't believe how fast Belles can move.
Already in Grenada. It feels like only yesterday that we were sailing past Gibraltar.
Are you feeling nostalgic?
Do we have time for that?
I don't. But you live life at a different speed.
You drag us all along with you, you know.
What can I say?
If I had my way, I would be on a beach - somewhere quiet and alcoholic - with a few disreputable souls with loose wallets.
Oh, speaking of disreputable souls. Is it true, what I heard?
Mm?
One of them met the Belle doctor.
Oh! Da, it's true. He got a tattoo from her, he says, and everything.
... A tattoo.
He's a sailor. Is that so strange?

Fields.MenuText: It's a specific enough detail it doesn't make sense for him to lie about it.
It seems odd to think of a doctor giving people tattoos.
I've heard some things about her tattoos...

Fields.DialogueText: You heard the one about the serpent on her face?
The one I heard about was a little lower down.
No one's better equipped to do it!
She knows how to sterilize a needle better than anyone, they say.
Oh, some people will lie about anything, you know...
But you trust him?
You trust the rumours?
The camera doesn't lie, Kapitan.
Is this a photo of our Monster?
Supposedly. Posmotret'--
... The one with the snake tattoo on her face.
Mm. Not a Morgana, at least.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, what the hell. They may need somebody like that down in the doctors' corner of the ship these days.

Fields.DialogueText: If the camera's telling the truth, yeah.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't dream of taking him away from the Monster, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo. I'll just tuck it away....
Sure, sure. But nothing in life is free...
Monster. How much do you want for it?
Make me your best offer.
*ALARM*
Do they always come to bother you right when you decide to leave the ship?
Sure would seem like it.
@BATTLE
My contact here could probably be enticed to transfer over, if you'd like to ask him about her. Or her medical techniques, for that matter.
He's a doctor?
Nyet. But I understand he's very good at holding people down for amputations. Look at those arms!
Thanks for the look at the photo, though. Very striking.
....And that's what we found. Crazy, how overnight it went from our highest priority to nothing.
You said it. Still, we've got to get the word out as far as we can.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you. I appreciate the help.
I hear your Belle is something of an expert at that...
I'll keep spreading it if you do.

Fields.DialogueText: Like a venereal disease.
She's a dear, but by God does she talk.
It's the least you should expect.
So. That fleet we just broke...  you said that's our biggest problem?
Not exactly. It was a vanguard.
*That* was a vanguard?!
Mm. The main fleet's en route. They've been harassing southern waters for months now--
I heard the reports. But I thought the fleet we routed *was* the dominant fleet--
They've been sending raiding parties this way for months, but it was just a couple days ago that their big force started moving.
Part of me wishes we'd never picked up that doohickey.
"Doohickey?"
The Morganas tried to set up a machine in the Puerto Rico Trench. We took possession of it, of course, dragged it off to Havana.
One of my boys has been studying it. -- Well, Abbott's not a boy, but she's young and scrappy. And she says -- it's the damnedest thing--
She says it's a weather control machine.
You ever wonder why every time Treason shows up, you get a thunderstorm?
Wait. It's another Heligoland device? Like the one the Germans were building at Christmas?
Looks like it. The good news is, they need a gadget the size of a cruiser to change anything. It does... somethin' about hydrogen? I couldn't follow the kid.
Point is, they can't change the weather without the damn thing.
And so now they want it back.
Yeah, and they've been getting more aggressive the more times they foul it up.
First it was just stragglers, you know. Little knots of Cowardices and Confusions.
Then the Diseases slunk in. Half the sea got sick, and we've got a few cases like your poor Doctor...
And now they're sending a whole damned navy.
That's about the size of it.
You want us to stay and help you deal with it?
It'd be appreciated, Captain. I know the INPF has its own plans--

Fields.MenuText: Keeping people safe is more important.
The INPF is trying to keep me out of trouble.
You've done me a good turn, I'll do you one too.

Fields.DialogueText: Much obliged, Captain.
And you want more trouble?
You really live up to your reputation, Captain.
It keeps me sane.
*ALARM*
That's the armada.
Let's do this, Captain. For Constitution?
For Constitution!
@BATTLE
You'd have to ask the Germans about that.
Say, Enoch-kun...
What's up, kid?
I was thinking about Disease again... and I think I realized something.
Mm?
We don't know whether or not she's magic.
Magic? I mean, on the one hand, she's a ghost ship who likes to dress up as a naughty nurse...
... But on the other hand, the Morganas aren't using magic guns and bombs.
They're using machines we can understand when we take them apart.
You're saying these are natural diseases, and not magic.
Mm! Something like that, anyway.
When it comes to the Morganas, is it ever that simple?
Oh! Kanchou!
Sorry for interrupting.
You're fine, Captain. We were just talking about Disease.
I'm not sure I buy that. They don't have to follow the laws of nature...
The Morganas are using stuff that's already here to kill us, ne?
Ohhhh. And you're arguing over whether or not she's magical?
Barely rose to the level of an "argument."
Just a friendly debate.
Where do *you* stand on it, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: This is off the record, but...
I try not to think about it too much.
Where I come down is, does it matter?

Fields.DialogueText: It matters, because if we can understand it, we can do something about it.
And if we can't understand it?
Then we still try to- oh. I think I see what you mean.
Leaving the thinking to me, Captain?
You're the Second Officer. Thinking is your job.
As long as you give me some of the credit.
Oh no.
... There have been more cases like Dr. van Geffen. Especially with Disease becoming more common.
That's terrible!
Most of the ones I've heard of are in heavy quarantine, far inland. Iowa, Geneva, Lucknow...
... So Disease can't get to them again?
And so they can't get to anyone else.
The thing I was really thinking...
If these are real diseases. The same way Morgana guns are real.
Couldn't we get our hands on them?
How do you figure?
If we board a Disease--
Oh brother.
*KSSSSSSH*
We're getting a message on that Morgana frequency again!
Patch her through.
-- merde, merde, bordel de merde--
Capitaine. This is the INPF ship with the ill docteur, non?
Yes. What's going on?
I'm a little tied up right now. --And not in a way I'd enjoy.
Infestation's swarmed farther north than we've seen her yet. If I don't destroy her, here and now--
Say no more.
Tell your docteur he'll have to do it himself. And--
Tell him I'm sorry.
*ALARM*
No need. We're tied up, ourselves.
These witches need to learn to ask permission.
@BATTLE
All right, you old battleaxe.
You told me you were in the best hands you could be. And you're a goddamn liar.
But I couldn't find anyone else. That Monster Belle can't get out here.
So I guess that makes me the best hands you've got.
Doctor? You haven't started yet, have you?
No. You coming to give me a speech?
No. Just to check in on you. Friend to friend.
I'm fine. She's the one you should worry about.
I'll keep this quick, then. -- I talked to our Belle.
You do that a lot, Captain.
She's offered to help you. Any way she can. Including... you know...
Ghosting through things?
Mm. I think her exact words were "if you need a hand on any organs..."
I'll give her a shout, yes.
... Now's your chance, Doctor.
Chance for what?

Fields.MenuText: To be a hero.
To be remembered.
To save lives.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't jinx me, Captain.
Is that a good thing, Captain?
Psh. I thought you said you weren't slinging speeches.
Whatever happens next, you'll be the first person to have done this operation.
Don't remind me.
I think you're good enough at your job that a jinx wouldn't get in your way.
It's corny, but I mean it.
You can do this. We'll drop the both of you off in the Bahamas when you're done.
How did you find my personal hell, Captain?
I didn't say you had to go *together*.
Yeah, yeah. Get out of my OR.
You're welcome, too.
*ALARM*
Another Disease?!
Oh, this day can't get any better.
I'll try to keep the ship steady.
Do that. And keep her at range.
Wilco, Doctor.
@BATTLE
The name of our Club's never felt *less* accurate.
Why not?
Well, I think every one of us gives a damn about how this operation goes.
No one more than you.
She's my friend. Not that you'd know
I have plenty of friends!
And how many of them are men you're screwing?
That's--  it's not LIKE that---
Girls, girls. Less fighting, more drinking?
I didn't chain myself to this bar for my health.
Fine. Keep them coming.
... Sorry, Lugin-san. She's impossible!
She's-- ?!
You've got some nerve.
I'm just honest!
I lost my last nerve in Baghdad, but you two are *very close* to getting on it.
Which is impressive, considering we're closer to Bermuda.
So. Drink up, get up, or shut up.
I'm *happy* to drink in *silence*, merci.
I *want* to get up! But there's nothing to *do*.  If I were a Belle I could at least help with the surgery, but--
Don't look now, but that might change.
Oh, Kanchou! Are you here to drink? I think we can get the radio on--
No. Call me your fairy grandmother, because I'm about to grant your goddamn wish.
Wait, are you saying--
As much as I don't want to at a time like this? Yes. You're boarding Disease.
EEEEEEEEEEEEEEE! Domo arigatou gozai--
Hey. Hey. Did you hear the part where you're boarding Disease?
I've got you and your party M1 gas masks, but that's all I could pick up short notice.
It's still exciting. I won't let you down, Kanchou, I promise!

Fields.MenuText: That's not what I'm worried about. You're reliable in a pinch.
You should take this a little more seriously.
Don't make promises unless you know you can keep them.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Don't you have faith in me?
I have a lot of faith in you. But not enough to take *this* on faith.
I'm taking it plenty seriously! This is my chance to prove I'm --
There's more at stake than what you've got to prove.
Only in a pinch?
Outside of a pinch? You do what you want.
*ALARM*
Get to the boat, *now*. We'll cover you.
Yatta!!! Let's do this!!!
Kapitan, out of curiosity...do you know how much she had to drink?
No, and I'm scared to find out.
@BATTLE
They've been down there a while, Kapitan.
I know.
They're not coming out.
You're hovering, Cassel.
There's nothing I can do, and I need to see if she--
KANCHOU!!!
Sayako!! Are you --  I mean-- What's your status?
Oh. August.
Let's not make this personal. Kirishima, status.
We're on our way back up. There was some wild stuff down there, but we're all okay.
Wild stuff? Do I want to know?
Things in tubes, racks of weird vials, a couple dozen skeletons...

Fields.MenuText: ...Things in tubes?
Weird vials?
...Human skeletons, or...?

Fields.DialogueText: Some of them! There was some weirder stuff, too- a skull with a throat sac like a pufferfish, and a skull with three eyes...
I'd say 'dead people' but I'm not sure they were human.
Most of them were clear. One or two looked like blood. I picked a couple of them up for testing.
Too disfigured to tell?
Mmhm. One tank was just one big tumor...
Creepy.
Good work, Yeoman.
We took photos, so once we've developed them, you can see.
Arigatou. We're on our way back up--
Kirishima! The ship's collapsing!
EVERYONE! UP ON DECK! *NOW*--
*KZZT*
Kirishima? Kirishima, report!
...Sayako....
SHE'S ALIVE!
Van Geffen's alive! God willing, she's going to make a full recovery.
That's, ah. That's good to hear.
We've got a situation, don't we.
The boarding party on Disease is -- the ship's collapsing.
Yep.
Serves me right for getting excited. What's going on?
Captain! We've got hostiles incoming.
That's the last thing we need.
@BATTLE
It's just one. A Mischief. She's...
She's not engaging with us. She's docking with the Disease...
The Disease is crumpling in on itself. But she's got a hull door open--
McPhee, are you saying what I think you're saying?
.....One... two... three... four... five. Yeah. That's. Every human who was aboard that ship. It happened so fast, but she's--
HEY! Hey, human ship!!!
Mischief?! I don't know what you're playing at, but--
Aw, I don't get a "thank you"?
A thank you?! Are you out of your mind?!
I saved your friends, didn't I? Unless.... they're *not* your friends? Heeheehee.
Don't hurt them!
Hee hee hee. That's what I thought.
If you want to get your friends back... maybe we can play a game?
Oh! I - I have a game idea.
I'm listening.... Hee. Hee.
Have you ever played Kakurenbo? Uh. Hide and seek.
Mayyyybe. Keep talking...
If you let my friends go-- I'll tell the Captain to send them to different ships in the Fleet. And then you and me can be the Oni- I mean, it.
And you and me ... find them... together?
Hai!!
I think.... that's a great idea. Hee. Hee Hee Hee.
And I stay aboard-- until the game's over. And then I get to go--
Sayako, that's crazy, do you really think-- she's a Nixe--
I know what I'm doing!
I'll be all right, Kanchou! Don't worry about--
Ten... nine... eight... seven...
Sayako, don't do this! We can rescue you--
Six... five... four....
Sayako, please--
Threetwoonebyyyyyyeeeeee!
*POP*
Captain... is that a lifeboat?
Well, I'll be. She... let them go?
...It's not going to be that easy. You heard her. She's going to hunt them down. And who knows what she's planning to do with Kirishima...
... Well, we're going to run into her again soon. One way or another.
...Her 'game'....
....And when we do... we'll get Kirishima back.
Until then.... everyone's alive. That will have to be enough.
Let's get this done fast, people! Our Belle has other things she needs to be doing!
